Reviews.Title: “AC broke down during my stay”
Reviews.Author: Hassan B
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this place for more than 5-6 months, once when i was there the whoel AC of the building broken down during summers and after 1 night they shifted us to another under construction hotel of theirs across the road. the rooms were being set up when i went there, and it was not at all pleasant experience, stayed there for 2 nights and then they shifted me to another hotel in tecom area which was much better. The lifts are always an issues esp during rush hours and its hard to get them on time!

Reviews.Title: “Good size suites good for 1 to two week stay”
Reviews.Author: Herbie88
Reviews.Content: Reception service is hopeless and very inefficient shows lack of training. Lifts are over worked and can take 5+ mins to return to room. Over 1,000 rooms. Location is out of CBS but on a metro. Great for bus travellers since easy picks for locals. Hotel is dry. Useful small shop on ground floor. Taxi rank outside. Crown and lion pub and Belgian beer bar within 5 minute walk. Gloria know by all taxi drivers. Gym very good. Pool average. Breakfast buffet good but not outstanding. Paper delivery not consistent. Good kids club and roof top Bball and soccer courts. Maid service and laundry very good. Good size clean modern rooms. Reasonable channel selection. Internet broken in first room I tried and was dodgy cat 5 cabling and they knew it but we're still selling room. Tip: use meeting room over looking palm on 39 floor. Business centre on ground floor very average.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: thierrryy
Reviews.Content: Except for the size of the room (quite large) there is nothing to like in this hotel. Arrogant staff at the reception and very poor sound isolation from the highway in front.... Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “T2!”
Reviews.Author: SaeedOraii
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a scientific meeting. We were a group of doctors and they gathered us on a so called reception which was actually a desk in the parking lot! People, some with family, had to stand there for up to 5 hours to get their rooms. They told me and a few others that we have rooms in 'T2'. It proved to be another tower on the other side of the highway. The rooms were comfortable and large. However, there was no phone, let alone internet in the rooms! No electricity in the kitchen! No electricity outlet in the bathroom! I had to use my shaver by connecting it to an outlet under my bed and use Mirror app of my iPhone! No safe box. No hair dryer. For breakfast or lunch you had to pass a long walkway across the highway bridge to 'T1'. On one side of the bridge there was not even a lift or escalator and you had to climb two flights of stairs. Even in the 'T1' there were not enough lifts. We had to use stairs several times after waiting a long time. When the lift arrived the priority was with the staff, not the guests! I have been several times in Dubai. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & comfortable 1 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: ferlaytio
Reviews.Content: The Gloria Hotel is located in a very convenient area 2 minutes walk to the metro at Internet City allowing you to explore Dubai cheaply and easily. The hotel itself is very comfortable. My company gets good rates there so put me up in a 1 bedroom suite on the 36th floor for 505 AED a night. Great price for a suite! It was very comfortable and the bed was excellent. The room was very clean also and had a balcony. There was a tv in the bedroom as well as the lounge area. Kitchen facilites were fine with a good sized fridge. There is also a gym and swimming pool in the hotel. Room service was good but the Noodle House on the ground floor will deliver to your room which is well worth a try. My only gripe with the hotel is the lifts can be very slow at peak times with so much people traffic & the wireless did not work on the 36th floor so had to connect using the cable provided in the lounge area (means you are restricted to web browsing only at the desk)

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Gloria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IDHAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at the Gloria Hotel whilst on a business trip to Dubai. Extremely clean hotel in a good location within the "Knowledge Village" precinct and just across the road from the very efficient Dubai rail system. Easy walking distance to the nearby universities and education facilities where there is a very good food hall and cafes available. There is a small supermarket close by as well. Plenty of taxis available 24 hours at the front of the hotel and taxi travel in Dubai is very cheap. Room was excellent complete with a small kitchen with microwave and a laundry room with a very modern and efficient washing machine and nice balcony to sit on and take in the views of the Dubai Marina area. A widescreen TV in both the lounge area and the bedroom plus a desk with internet access. To use the telephone for international calls required a credit card deposit. I found the staff to be obliging and friendly and would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel is "dry" so if you do need a drink to wash out the desert dust, the Crown and Lion Hotel is within a 5 minute walk just past the Dubai Internet City railway station. The hotel foyers etc are non-smoking and non-smoking rooms are available. As mentioned by previous reviewers, the lifts are quite slow as they stop at all floors but if that's all there is to complain about, perhaps we're too fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Gloria hotel 6 month stay”
Reviews.Author: hugt k
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 6 months and it is not a 4 star hotel. Be aware when you check in that you do not get a room facing sheik zayed road as the noise at night is unbearable and you will never sleep, on thursday night the guy in a porsche at 1130pm will wake you up every thursday, at 4am you will get the ferraris racing each other and Friday pm the harleys, its awful, ear plugs, sleeping tablets will not help, i managed 4 hours sleep most nights from 2am to 6am and thats it, so bad i feared for my health, mention it to the staff and they tell you all the rooms are booked up yet its clear that this hotel runs at 60% occupancy most of the time. Staff on the door and at reception are okay and the teams on the floors are great guys , management when informed of problems are awful, check into long stay is a lottery and you will be waiting for 45mins to check in, then the card machine will not work, they take a "deposit" of 2k AED and never tell you why they need it...fair enough i suppose, but really just shows you the type of hotel they are. The rooms are fairly well sized and they look okay, but when you stay long you notice all types of problems, cheap furniture, bits falling off, air con either -15 or +45 and a kitchen that has no cooker except a hob which is dangerous. Be careful when there are holidays as its is very very busy expect long queues of families who cant carry a bag and expect to be valet parked which means that when you want to park your car you will wait sometimes 15mins behind big 4 by 4s who have been told there is valet parking, it gets very very noisy, and gets large groups of guys who want to party fair enough i suppose but at 4am full blasyt music, management respind by turning off their electricity, they are scared to make a fuss !, lifts take a week to get it and are not suitable for a hotel this size, be patient when waiting and dont queue just get in as soon as the door opens otherwise your politeness will not be appreciated, parking is dangerous and its best to park on the bottom floor, if you go upstairs there is a long walk to the main reception difficult when you have shopping. The charges vary between 80k per year to 125k per year for a one or 2 bed, negotiate very hard and dont pay the list although it takes an age to sort this out, bfast is a rip off and awful but the buffet dinner is good, they also do shisha if you want . Its handy for the metro and taxis into dubai mall etc, say 20 mins to the hotspots, the pool is only in the sunlight for 2 hours from early am till 11 and then shade but its full all the time, the gym is good standard but the showers are dirty and smell, they are always being cleaned. The hotel has a history of issues with water, air con, electricity and charges changing at one weeks notice, they are always slipped under your door and when you want to discuss it the GM is never there and he doesnt care either, i had several agreements to move my room none of which were enforced, the staff at long stay blatantly lie and smile at the same time, but i think they cant make any decision , customer service is not their priority, just taking your card and money. For the price its probably okay if you get it cheap ie 85 for 12 months as it does include TV and internet, the internet is so slow you cant even open email, its a joke and it will never improve, as it needs investment and this hotel is a cash cow aimed at the EE market and people who think its cheap, nothing is cheap un Dubai and certainly never hotels. overall one night or a week is okay, long stay would be okay at 65k per year at the back of the hotel , otherwise its one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed in ( i count myself as a very experienced hotel user with at least 150 nights per year travelling, sadly )

Reviews.Title: “Try it!”
Reviews.Author: vahid1357
Reviews.Content: it was very clean, glorious, comfortable,... rooms are actually a suite ( sitting room,bed room, kitchen,...) if you take a room in higher floors you can enjoy the nice view from the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Dubai A
Reviews.Content: The place has some great guys, but a couple of great guys do not make for a great hotel! The account guys, the front office guys (with the exception of a few) are the rudest people I have ever had the displeasure of meeting in the hospitality industry. The Chefs are excellent, the room service sucks, the staff at the hotel all seem disappointed with life and the management! What a great hotel going to waste! Had i written this review last year, it would have been a different story. All the good guys seem to have moved, and please don't get me started on the 'Long Term Desk', they need to close that down! its ridiculous how useless the girls there are!

Reviews.Title: “aslee”
Reviews.Author: abdulaziz o
Reviews.Content: Nice location, the internet city metro station is next to the hotel. The staffs are helpful. Mini supermarket in the lobby, breakfast very nice, far from city center, I recommended this hotel for family

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DramaLuver
Reviews.Content: i stayed in a suite, so there were different views for me and my family. all the views are wonderful, i could sit and watch the window for a long time. one one side is the beach and burj alarab, the other the dubai palm(the palm tree shape in the sea), and everywhere you look you can see the tall beautiful buildings of dubai. service is excellent, they offer you arabic coffee and dates when you sit in the lounge, they have a spa and also whats really nice is that its right in front of the metro station, so i would just walk to the station and it would cheaply take me to my destination

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Natalia L
Reviews.Content: The best thing is hotel's location, near to Dubai Marina (5-7 min. by taxi), Palm Jumeirah/Aquaventure (10-15 min by taxi on top of the palm), Mall of Emirates (10 min. by metro), The Dubai Mall/Burj Khalifa (15 min. by metro). Metro station (Internet City) is right next to the hotel. Hotel is more far away from Deira district, but it takes just a bit longer trip by metro. Our room was quite small compared with hoteliers photo, but there was everything you need, incl. all necessary hygiene items in the bathroom. Somewhat indifferent staff at the restaurant, we waited for someone to make an omelet and to bring us coffee for a long time. Big minus - we didn't have time to visit the beach and we we hoped to cool off in the pool, but it was under repairing. Overall, we would be happy to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for Dubai Attractions”
Reviews.Author: GregBJ
Reviews.Content: The Gloria Hotel in Dubai has a lot to offer travellers to the city, either for pleasure or business. Located next to the Internet City metro station, it gives easy access to many of Dubai's shopping malls and attractions. The hotel itself is spacious with excellent apartment accommodation. The apartment I stayed in had two double bedrooms, two bathrooms, a lounge with dining areas, well appointed kitchen and twin balconies. There was free internet access and flat screen televisions in lounge and bedrooms. The views from the rooms are panoramic, either looking toward Downtown Dubai with its iconic Burj Kalifa (the tallest building in the world), or towards the sea withe the famous Palm Island Complex and the Atlantis Hotel. The hotel boasted excellent conference facilities with centres on the fourth and 41st floor. However some of the training rooms lacked natural light and were quite basic in their design. This was more than compensated for by the excellent catering facilities in the central lobby. The staff were helpful and very polite. The hotel offers a superb gym, several swimming pools and a children's club as well as a couple of good restaurants and a bar in the lobby. There is also ample parking for anyone brave enough to drive in the city. The only draw back to the hotel is its slow lifts. One of my delegates had to wait for over 10 minutes for a lift to arrive! Also, the lifts are used by all of the hotel staff, so after waiting for one to arrive you may not be able to get in as it is full of staff and equipment. Overall I had an enjoyable six night stay in the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joel019
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to Dubai. I would certainly stay in this hotel again. The staff were effecient with check-in and check-out. The room (I had a suite) was perfect for my week's stay. A good size bathroom, an equiped kitchen, comfortable bedroom, a living room with a couch, and a good size balcony with views over Dubai from the 36th floor. There was also an outdoor pool and a very well equiped gym. I really liked the hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: I am being put up here by my company whilst in Dubai for 6 months, in an 'apartment room' with cooker and washing machine. I travel a lot with work and having lived here for more than 3 months my overriding impression of the Gloria is that it continually falls short of the expectations of a 4 star hotel. Since I arrived I have encountered a multitude of problems, including: - been told on arrival that the apartment room my company had booked was not available and I would be placed in a room with no cooking facilities or washing machine for "we don't know how long". The junior on the long stay check in desk could not explain to me why the hotels room booking system is clearly failing, but thankfully after a complaint letter to the sales manager an apartment was produced for me the following day. - I was then charged a 2,000 Dirham deposit. Most hotels simply hold this as space on your credit card but the Gloria hotel has actually taken 2,000 AED of my money. Because room service meals are so poor I would estimate I have used only 200 AED of this amount in the last 3 months - the Gloria are certainly getting the benefit of my cash on deposit. - the set of lights in the bedroom operated by remote control failed when i checked in at 4 am and I had to wait an hour for someone to come up, get a spare part and fix it so I could switch it off and go to sleep. I have also had problems with blinds breaking, curtains come off rails and fuses blowing. These issues have been fixed relatively quickly but it does feel like just one issue after another and as if the fixtures and fittings have been done on the cheap. Drawers in the furniture are ill fitting and hard to use. - my booked airport pick up (at 4am) did not turn up. - the lifts are, as everyone has noted, inadequate for such a large hotel - there is a usual 5-10 minute wait and sometimes longer. - the pool gets sun until only about 10am so is useless for sunbathing. - the washing machine will only operate on one programme - I've asked for this to be fixed and nothing has happened. The machine often gives out an unpleasant smell, as noted by another reviewer. There is also a very unpleasant smell underneath the kitchen sink. - the mattress is extremely worn down and offers no back support. I asked for this to be changed, since I have a damaged disc in my lumbar spine, but it was replaced with one of equally poor quality. - the wardrobe has a built in light which is supposed to go on when the doors are opened, but because the doors do not fit properly it is extremely difficult to get the light to switch off - and I've then had it randomly come on at 4 am and wake me up. After using a gym shoe to try and keep it closed, then cellotape, I have now simply removed the light bulb. - the decor is not at all to my taste and I have put away in cupboards many of the gold 'decorations'. There is a large arm chair in the bedroom which takes up too much space but when I asked for it to be taken out the sole staff member who came up was unable to get it through the door. - the cleaning is often hit and miss - the rugs are not regularly vacuumed and when furniture is moved eg the chair in the bedroom, there is a lot of dust behind. - the internet access is wired only - unbelievable in this day and age - and is extremely unreliable dropping in and out for no clear reason and running extremely slowly when it is working. I wanted to keep in touch with family and friends via skype but the internet is not good enough - don't even bother trying. Uploading photos to share via the internet will take an entire evening. The wireless internet available in the hotel lobby is equally unreliable. - the hot water is often unavailable for 'routine maintenance'. This is notified by letter under the door at extremely short notice. - the gas oven has no temperature indicator - simply a low or high setting. I have now received a notice that the gas cooking facilities will be removed unless I sign a disclaimer. I have requested a copy of the disclaimer be sent to my room to run past my company (who are footing the bill) and it has yet to be provided (some 2 weeks later). I have raised many concerns since I arrived and generally they have been resolved pretty quickly. I am disappointed that some still haven't been (eg washing machine, internet). I was also assured that the long stay manager takes my concerns seriously and would like to meet with me but this meeting has never materialised. The location is convenient for metro and cabs to the marina, palm or madinat jumeirah. The door staff, getting cabs and helping with shopping etc have always been helpful and friendly as have the numerous service engineers that have visited the room. Staff behind the desks much less so. Overall I think this could be a good hotel but too many things are not up to standard. I would hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vale for Money”
Reviews.Author: sherif2011
Reviews.Content: Get a suite for a price of room on Shikh Zayed rd. Really good deal ..

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels u have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: drparisa
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 days in this hotel....howww nice was the hotel,,that u should go and see,,from first,,close to metro station,,that by it u can go everywhere so easily,,,,,all of the rooms are about 8o meters apartment,,with kitchen,,buiness room,,table,,for work,,2 lcd tv in yr apartments,,wowwwww...they got a little deposite from us that even is not worth to saying,,for that really 6 star hotel,and they give u when check out,,and u have so many snaks and drinks in refrigerator complimentary,,,i have seen many hotels in countries,,but this is special!!!i can tell u in breakfast u dont know what to eat,,how many choices u have...finally,,swimming pool and suna and jakuzy,,if u beleive they r open from 8am to 10;30 pm!! with view to sheykhzayed road,,and see,,that is so nice,,especially in night when u go to jacuzi for relaxing,,,howwwww generous hotel,,a hotel that europian in hotel all of then was surpried with seeing so nice hotel,,thank u so much gloria hotel

Reviews.Title: “Extra credit card fees, rude account manager but good gym”
Reviews.Author: dubaidogfish
Reviews.Content: Very rude and dismissive head of accounts, said is hotel policy to charge extra 5% on ALL credit card payments within the hotel including payment for room. When I told him I had payed for dinner there without the extra charge he told me perhaps he should go back and add the charge extra to me with a smirk on his face! Why this person still has a job is beyond me but staff standards are obviously pitiful. Happily in another hotel, one of many who laughed openly at this when I told them Gloria policy, this place is getting a reputation in Dubai for all the wrong reasons. They seem to be stuck in the 1970s along with their Med style rooms despite being relatively new. Lifts take literally 15mins to arrive and are packed with staff and their trolleys. Trying to get your car unloaded to check in is a joke as you are waved to drive on despite informing them you are checking in. The gym is good but with the way you are treated by management who cares.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but building faults can marr the experience”
Reviews.Author: IanElliott
Reviews.Content: essentially OK but water supply and aircon can fail and take a long time to fix

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced and nicely furnished but...”
Reviews.Author: MeliPotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Gloria hotel after being highly disappointed with the Grand emirates hotel in dubai. There were four of us and we booked 2 x 2 bedroom apartments. Check in was a bit slow but the reception was beautiful. We stayed on the 30th floor but this was generally fine as the lifts were fast with the exception of breakfast time when we usually had to wait over 5 minutes for the lift. The rooms were nicely furnished. In each of the apartments we booked, there was one room with 2 single beds and one room with a double bed and en suite bathroom. Worth noting is the fact that the apartments were different sizes, with one being significantly bigger than the other so you may want to have a look before being allocated a room. There was also a separate kitchinette but unlike most other hotels of its type in Dubai there is no cooker so it was a bit annoying not being able to fry an egg if i was late for the free buffet breakfast. we ordered food from room service from the hotel's main restaurant on one occasion and it was higly disappointing to say the least. i was told the food would take 30minite but it took over an hour. The Grilled lobster i ordered was not fresh and therefore inedible. when i called to make a complaint the waiter on the other end actually started arguing with me on the freshness of the lobster until i firmly insisted on a replacement meal. A waiter was sent down to inspect the meal before the finally decided to give me another meal. I asked for lamb with vegetables and mashed potatoes instead of polenta. the lamb came an hour later and there were no vegetables to be found. if staying at this hotel, enjoy the nice buffet breakfast and do try the Noodle House restaurant which has nice asian food but do not bother ordering into the room or odering on the a la carte menu in the restaurant on the 8th floor because the food is just horrible. the hotel entrace is almost directly opposite the Dubai Internet city Metro station, making easy acess to city centre, Dubai mall , the world trade centre and numerous other tourist destinations. It was ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexKBerlin
Reviews.Content: During my two week trip to Dubai, the company had arranged for a nice one bed room apartment in the Gloria Hotel. In midst of all the great hotels in Dubai, the Gloria Hotel doesn't have to hide! Very spacious rooms, great view of the Palm and friendly and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pool leaves a lot to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: Iman T
Reviews.Content: I am extremely particular about cleanliness, and I have to say the bathroom, the bed, the furniture and everything was new and spotless. Good housekeeping kept up the cleanliness too. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Two TVs, one in the bed room one in the living room. No stove in the rooms but a microwave is available in all kitchens. This unlike most hotel apartments which have poor service gives the excellent service of a hotel...Staff are very friendly. The breakfast and lunch buffets are very complete and comprehensive...The hotel has about 10-11 elevators so not much delay in getting to upper floors (our room was on 31st) HOWEVER ....the pool water was NOT very clear. Some tiles on the pool floor were broken and off... The pool is located on the 8th floor so with 3 blocks of 41 stories around the pool you get little sunlight..around a couple of hours sunlight in the morning and a couple of hours in the evening sun...so not the best place for a sun tan either, which disappointed my fiancee. . however sauna, fitness centre all else is great. I'd suggest it for anyone on business (free high speed internet, breakfast served from 6, close to Dubai business centres and metro) but not for people after a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel apt.. very comfortable.. will come back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Karam s
Reviews.Content: I took my chances and booked this hotel apt. It's a new property so not much reviews were available. Its located on the road facing the main Sheikh Zayed Road based in Media City. 40 mins drive from airport. The rooms were "A" Class and very comfortable. I almost felt almost at home.. The living room was big enough for 6 people to sit comfortably. I had a city view room so dint step out on balcony much. Room had all basic amenities and was well furnished. Bedroom is extremely comfortable. Kitchen is well furnished too and has most of the stuff required to cook..though I dint but I'm sure it has plenty enough. Plus there is dining table for four. There is a separate room for washing machine and ironing was there too. Bathroom is modern and well made.I was able to work comfortably as there was a work desk plus had free internet. The hotel is surrounded by a very nice Thai restaurant which has awesome food and reasonable priced.subway is also nearby. Further grocery market is walking distance. You can order from 100s of restaurants which are near by and delv in half an hour. Its 15 mins drive by taxi to emirates mall and is at a calm location much cleaner than other place I will suggest this hotel for people who want luxury at reasonable price. Very economical for huge families.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, And hotel Apartments”
Reviews.Author: EddieDXB
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one week on a business trip, amazing hotel, very huge, nice view and just a few minutes away from media city where my company office was.. two thumbs up.. Ps: when you book ask for apartment where u get a fully equipped kitchen ,and washing machine inside the room, they dont sell it unless your staying for more than a month, but its Worth a try

Reviews.Title: “You dont feel your legs before you sleep , really big rooms ;)”
Reviews.Author: cancnt
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone , I stayed in Gloria Hotel for 1 week , there is actually like semi-skyscraper :) Dont forget to adjust your time for going to toilet in your room , so there is huge , just like an apart house. All rooms have big kitchen , balconies , 2 baths , 1 sitting room , 1 dinner&lunch table , business area and sleeping rooms . There is really more comfortable than Hilton . Also all staffs are very helpful . They think for everything for your Dubai trip. Also you dont need any taxi ( till midnight ) , you'll find Metro station , that in front of the hotel. Burj Khalifa and most popular places are far away only a few metro station. However if you want to walk to Burj Al Arab Hotel or Palm Jumeriah . Its possible but when you return , you need a taxi to the hotel . Have a nice trip !

Reviews.Title: “large rooms, friendly staff, not so good bed, noisy”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on the 37th floor. Rooms (Suites as they call it) are large with bedroom, living room, kitchen, bathroom, baggage storage room. Living room equipped with large flat screen, sofa, desk. Free Internet (wired only - wireless only in the lobby area). Bathroom nice with all amenities you need, good shower with sufficient water pressure even on the 37th floor. Bedroom quite large as well but the bed felt really uncomfortable. It was way to soft for my liking. A/C was a bit of a hit and miss, it would not allow you to regulate the temperature. Basically I woke up at 3am with the temp being 18 degrees only. (Solution: switch it off, open window and it'll be 25 in 10 minutes). My room was facing Sheikh Zayed Road and was quite noisy all the time. Ask for a room facing the sea. Have not used the SPA and/or pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Glena
Reviews.Content: The Gloria Hotel is very conveniently-located. If you just have a handcarry, you can take the Metro from the airport to the stop in front of the hotel. Our 2-bedroom had two balconies and two full baths, a fully-equipped kitchen, and an open living-dining-worktable area. It was very spacious and very clean. The breakfast buffet (with a lot of choices, including eggs cooked to order) is in a big dining room with big windows; the room is bright and airy. Internet is free (wired in the room and wireless in the lobby). The staff (at all stations) are very pleasant and helpful as well. Definitely worth the money and very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Deceitful & Dishonest...Don't Stay There!”
Reviews.Author: ummaayah
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel if you are seeking to stay in a 1 or 2 bedroom. After finding this hotel on the internet, my husband went to view the hotel and was shown a fully equipped, fully furnished apartment. We checked in only to realize that our apartment did not have a stove/cooker nor a washing machine as indicated on the website. In addition, the phone didn't work and the living room A/C was out. After complaining, we were rudely told by the Asst. GM, Adnan, that nothing could be done. In his duplicity, he first explained that the website was incorrect and that our room was a 2 bedroom "suite" so it didn't include a cooker/washing machine inspite of the mention of fully furnished kitchen. After further pushing from my husband, he finally admitted that the website was a marketing strategy to get people to the hotel! Finally, at 10:30 pm with my husband's angry insistence (8 hours after checking in), we were finally moved to another room. With all of this Mr. Adnan continued his rudeness and we checked out the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Aquariustraveller
Reviews.Content: Service is extremely bad. Waited one hour and a half for an iron after calling several times, not very clean bathrooms, 45 minute wait to get a bell captain to pick up our bags for check out. When complained to hotel manager he didn't even apologize and even talked behind my back to a colleague in Arabic thinking I would not understand! incredibly rude. The hotel is so badly designed that there are not enough elevators to cope with the number of rooms so it takes 20 minutes to get to and from your room! Horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great location, hotel and view!”
Reviews.Author: Katikinnz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel based on location, price and amenities (gym and pool). We got so much more than we asked for! FOOD: We didn't get room service at all - there is a Dominos, Subway, grochery store and food court less than 5 min walk away. ROOM: Wow! I was expecting a hotel room and got an apartment complete with kitchen (toaster oven, full-size fridge and sink), dining room, living room (with TV), bedroom (king-size bed and TV) and even a balcony! FYI - An extra cot is 100AED. From the 32nd floor, we had an amazing city view - the balcony made it that much better! (Don't forget to buy your booze at the airport!!!) FYI - There also is NO BAR in this hotel! AMENITIES: 22m pool - loved it! You can sunbathe there in the morning, but in the afternoon, you have to go to the other side of the building. The gym was great too... tons of brand new cardio machines. New weights and great selection (mostly machines though, and light dumbells, there IS a leg-press though)! :) LOCATION: AWESOME! Quick cab away from everything... Irish Pub, Barasti Beach Bar, JBR sidewalk, The Palm, Atlantis, Burj, Wild Wadi and Emirates Mall. PRICE: We paid $360 USD for 3 nights!!! Great deal! Also booked through South Travel, who processed my visa for me (fast and hassle-free) for $150USD. VISA: $150 - Quick and hassle-free with South Travels! http://www.southtravels.com/ TOTALLY recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to enjoy Jurmeriah Beach Area - Pubs, The Palm, Atlantis, Wild Wadi, Emirates Mall, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extremly bad apartment”
Reviews.Author: re_man_ism
Reviews.Content: Hi, Though this is very good looking inside but service of the apartment is very bad. The hotel manager in the front desk stares you likes he is going to kill you.. Staff is non cooperating and very rude. Major of the basic thing is missing in the apartment which is suppose to be there in a 4 star hotel. The star rating of the hotel is fake.. I'll advise not to stay in this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Gloria Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayed Road | Media City, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
